For example, the entity did not procure 2 pool vehicles, one tipper, two mini buses, and did not erect a fence over Kampala headquarter land, among others. Details in Appendix II. Accounting Officer explained that failure to implement all planned activities and outputs fully was due to the Covid 19 pandemic lockdown effect and low realization of funds both internal and GoU support. Bn Table The

5.6 Accuracy of Performance reports submitted 55 of the budget execution circular for the financial year 2019/2020 states that the Accounting Officer is required to submit quarterly performance reports by the 30 th day of the first month of the following quarter. These reports should clearly indicate the actual performance against the planned outputs and performance for each quarter, showing the quantity/quality and physical location of the reported outputs against expenditure. my review of the annual cumulative performance reports and physical inspections/verification of performance, I noted that whereas departments prepared quarterly performance reports, and annual performance report prepared by the Corporation, most of the planned outputs were reported on in generic form. This made proper assessment of performance difficult. No explanation was given for this anomaly. Paragraph From
column14: I advised the Accounting Officer to ensure that all planned outputs are accurately reported on in the annual performance report to enable effective assessment of budget performance.
